base_translation: The discovery was an archaeology professor.

You think the correct translation is: The discovery was an archaeology professor. Restate the translation and provide your reasons.

I believe the correct translation of the Chinese text "发现的是一个考古教授" is "What was discovered was an archaeology professor." 

In the original Chinese text, the subject is "一个考古教授" (an archaeology professor), and the focus is on the fact that this individual was discovered. Therefore, the emphasis is on the discovery itself rather than the identity of the archaeology professor. By translating it as "What was discovered was an archaeology professor," we maintain this emphasis on the act of discovery.
